title: Infosys shares fall 1.66% in today's session; over 56.4 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Infosys were trading lower in Wednesday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 1,654.80, a 1.66% decrease from the previous close. Over 56.4 lakh shares were traded. On the financial front, Infosys has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual results. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending December 2025 stood at Rs 45,479 Crore, compared to Rs 41,764 Crore in December 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 6,666 Crore, slightly lower than the Rs 6,822 Crore reported in the previous year. The earnings per share (EPS) for December 2025 was Rs 16.17, compared to Rs 16.43 in December 2024. Here's a detailed look at Infosys's key quarterly financial figures: The company's annual performance also reflects positive momentum. Infosys reported a consolidated revenue of Rs 162,990 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, up from Rs 153,670 Crore in the previous year. Net profit increased to Rs 26,750 Crore from Rs 26,248 Crore. The EPS also saw an increase, rising to Rs 64.50 in March 2025 from Rs 63.39 in March 2024. Here's an overview of the key annual financial highlights: The annual income statement shows that Infosys sales increased from Rs 153,670 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 162,990 Crore in March 2025. The net profit also increased from Rs 26,248 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 26,750 Crore in March 2025. Infosys announced a strategic collaboration with Cursor to accelerate software engineering for global enterprises on January 27, 2026. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment for the stock as of January 28, 2026. Shares of Infosys were last traded at Rs 1,654.80, experiencing a decline from its previous close, with significant trading volume.

title: Bharti Airtel share price falls 1.70%, hits intraday low of Rs 1,939
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading at Rs 1,939.80, a decline of 1.70% in Wednesday's session. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 1,995 and a day's low of Rs 1,939. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. On the financial front, Bharti Airtel has demonstrated consistent growth in both quarterly and annual revenues. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending September 2025 stood at Rs 52,145.40 Crore, up from Rs 41,473.30 Crore in September 2024. Net profit for the same quarter was Rs 8,569.80 Crore, compared to Rs 3,079.50 Crore in the previous year. The company's Earnings Per Share (EPS) also increased from Rs 6.21 to Rs 11.72 during this period. Here is a detailed look at the quarterly financial performance of Bharti Airtel: The annual financial performance shows a similar upward trend. For the year-ending March 2025, revenue reached Rs 172,985.20 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 100,615.80 Crore in 2021. Net profit also saw a significant turnaround, from a loss of Rs 23,327.90 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 33,778.30 Crore in 2025. The company's EPS improved from -Rs 27.65 to Rs 58.00 during the same period. The consolidated annual income statement shows consistent growth across key metrics. Sales increased from Rs 100,615 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 172,985 Crore in March 2025. Total income also rose from Rs 101,258 Crore to Rs 174,558 Crore during the same period. The company's net profit saw a significant turnaround, moving from a loss of Rs 23,327 Crore in March 2021 to a profit of Rs 33,778 Crore in March 2025. Key figures from the consolidated annual income statement are presented below: The company’s balance sheet for March 2025 shows total assets of Rs 514,360 Crore, compared to Rs 346,027 Crore in March 2021. The company's debt-to-equity ratio has decreased from 2.20 in 2021 to 1.13 in 2025. Key financial ratios for Bharti Airtel show a P/E ratio of 29.89 and a P/B ratio of 7.65 as of March 2025. The company announced an earnings call to be held on February 06, 2026, regarding the audited financial results for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 16 per share with effective date as July 18, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bearish sentiment for the stock as of January 28, 2026.

title: Buy UTI AMC; target of Rs 1400: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on UTI AMC UTI AMC’s 3QFY26 operating revenue came in at INR3.9b (in line), reflecting a growth of 5% YoY/flat QoQ. Yield on management fees came in at 40.1bp in 3QFY26 vs 42.6bp in 3QFY25 and 41.2bp in 2QFY26. For 9MFY26, operating revenue grew 7% YoY to INR11.6b. Total opex came in at INR2.1b, registering a growth of 16% YoY but a decline of 11% QoQ. EBITDA came at INR1.8b (18% beat) in 3QFY26 (declining 6% YoY but rising 21% QoQ), and EBITDA margins stood at 45.6% in 3QFY26 vs 50.8% in 3QFY25. Outlook We expect UTI to report a CAGR of 15%/11%/15% in AUM/revenue/core PAT over FY25-28E. We reiterate our BUY rating with a one-year TP of INR1,400 (based on 17x FY28E EPS). title: Buy Supreme Industries; target of Rs 4200: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Supreme Industries Despite lower-than-expected performance, Supreme Industries (SI) saw an improvement in its quarterly result, with an EBITDA growth of ~7% in 3QFY26 (vs. a dip in the last five quarters). The improvement was mainly driven by high overall volume growth of 13% YoY. Margins were flat YoY due to volatile PVC pricing in 3Q, offset by a better product mix. Plastic pipe volume rose ~16% YoY, with volume growth guidance maintained at ~15-17% for FY26. This implies a 20-24% YoY volume growth in 4Q. Outlook We expect SI to clock 12%/18%/18% CAGR in revenue/EBITDA/PAT over FY25 28. We value the stock at 34x FY28 EPS to arrive at a TP of INR4,200 (on par with its last 10-year average P/E valuation). Reiterate BUY. title: Buy SRF; target of Rs 3660: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on SRF SRF delivered a healthy performance in 3QFY26 as EBIT surged 25% YoY, fueled by a strong 36% YoY jump in chemical segment EBIT, despite persistent global headwinds. Performance films and foil (PFF) EBIT grew by 5% YoY, while technical textiles EBIT declined 24% YoY. The chemical business (specialty chemicals and fluorochemicals segments) is expected to maintain its growth momentum, led by the traction in new products, pent-up orders from 2Q and 3Q, a stable or better pricing outlook for refrigerants, and the second pharma intermediate plant expected to be commissioned in the next eight months. Outlook We build in a CAGR of 13%/24%/32% of revenue/EBITDA/Adj. PAT over FY25 28E. We reiterate our BUY rating and value the stock on an SoTP basis to arrive at our TP of INR3,660. title: Buy PNB Housing; target of Rs 1200: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on PNB Housing PNB Housing’s (PNBHF) 3QFY26 PAT grew 8% YoY to ~INR5.2b (5% miss). NII rose ~11% YoY to ~INR7.7b (in line). Other income declined ~10% QoQ to ~INR1b, owing to lower fee income and investment income. Opex rose ~17% YoY to ~INR2.4b (up 10% QoQ). Reiterate BUY with a TP of INR1,200 (based on 1.4x Dec’27E BVPS). title: Buy InterGlobe Aviation; target of Rs 6100: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on InterGlobe Aviation InterGlobe Aviation (INDIGO) reported a flat YoY EBITDAR of INR58.6b (est. INR59.8b) and an adjusted profit of INR20.5b (est. INR21.7b) in 3QFY26. EBITDA (ex-forex loss) was INR64.7b (down 2% YoY), as forex loss stood at INR11b vs. INR14.6b in 3QFY25. Due to capacity moderation, INDIGO is expecting a mid-single-digit growth in unit cost (ex. fuel and forex) for FY26. title: Buy KEI Industries; target of Rs 5120: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on KEI Industries KEI Industries’ (KEII) 3QFY26 earnings were above our estimates, led by higher than-estimated margin in C&W segment. Total revenue grew ~19% YoY to INR29.5b (in line), while EBITDA increased ~32% YoY to INR3.3b (~6% beat). OPM expanded 1.1pp YoY to ~11% (80bp above our estimates). Adjusted PAT rose ~48% YoY to INR2.4b (~7% beat). Management indicated a strong demand outlook in domestic and export markets, highlighting continued strong momentum in institutional, retail and overseas segments. It remains confident of delivering +20% revenue growth in FY26 and ~25% growth in 4QFY26, aided by higher copper prices. KEII is targeting ~20% CAGR over the next 3-4 years, led by Sanand ramp-up, strong order inflows, and export growth. It expects to achieve EBITDA margin of ~11% in FY27. Reiterate BUY. title: Tata Consultancy Services shares gain 0.91%, touch intraday high of Rs 3,205.20
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services were trading positively on Wednesday, with the stock priced at Rs 3,186.60 as of 2.30 pm, a gain of 0.91% from the previous close. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 3,205.20 and a day's low of Rs 3,170.60. Tata Consultancy Services is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. Here's an overview of the financial performance of Tata Consultancy Services: The revenue for the quarter-ending December 2025 was Rs 67,087.00 Crore, compared to Rs 63,973.00 Crore in December 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 10,720.00 Crore, while the net profit in December 2024 was Rs 12,444.00 Crore. The Earnings per share (EPS) decreased to 29.45 in December 2025, from 34.21 in December 2024. The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 255,324.00 Crore, an increase from Rs 240,893.00 Crore in 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 48,797.00 Crore compared to Rs 46,099.00 Crore in 2024. The Earnings per share (EPS) increased from 125.88 in 2024 to 134.19 in 2025. Tata Consultancy Services announced an interim dividend of Rs 11.00 per share and a special dividend of Rs 46.00 per share, with an effective date of January 16, 2026. Other recent dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 11.00 per share on October 15, 2025, another interim dividend of Rs 11.00 per share on July 16, 2025, and a final dividend of Rs 30.00 per share on June 4, 2025. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, with the last bonus issue on April 19, 2018, in the ratio of 1:1. A Moneycontrol analysis from January 21, 2026, indicated a bearish sentiment on the stock. Shares of Tata Consultancy Services were trading positively on Wednesday, with the stock priced at Rs 3,186.60, a gain of 0.91% from the previous close.

title: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries shares decline 2.03% amid volume surge
content: Shares of Sun Pharmaceutical Industries experienced a decline of 2.03% to trade at Rs 1,605.60 on Wednesday. The stock witnessed high trading volume, accompanied by a volume surge. The company is a constituent of the Nifty 50 index. Financial Overview: In the quarter-ending September 2025, Sun Pharmaceutical Industries reported revenue of Rs 14,478.31 Crore and a net profit of Rs 3,137.09 Crore. In comparison, the revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025, stood at Rs 13,851.40 Crore with a net profit of Rs 2,302.62 Crore. The revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 12,958.84 Crore with a net profit of Rs 2,160.64 Crore. For the quarter-ending December 2024, the company's revenue stood at Rs 13,675.46 Crore and net profit at Rs 2,917.54 Crore. The quarter-ending September 2024 recorded a revenue of Rs 13,291.39 Crore and a net profit of Rs 3,030.67 Crore. The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 52,578.44 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 10,980.10 Crore. In the previous year-ending March 2024, the revenue was Rs 48,496.85 Crore and the net profit was Rs 9,648.44 Crore. The revenue for the year-ending March 2023 was Rs 43,885.68 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 8,560.84 Crore. The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2022 was Rs 38,654.49 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 3,405.82 Crore. For the year-ending March 2021, the revenue stood at Rs 33,498.14 Crore and net profit at Rs 2,284.68 Crore. The basic EPS for year-ending March 2025 was Rs 45.60, as compared to Rs 39.90 for year-ending March 2024. The debt to equity ratio was 0.03 as of March 2025. According to Moneycontrol analysis, the sentiment for Sun Pharmaceutical Industries is very bearish as of January 28, 2026. Sun Pharmaceutical Industries announced an interim dividend, with effective date being February 5, 2026. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 1,605.60, Sun Pharmaceutical Industries experienced a decline of 2.03%.

title: Buy IndiaMART; target of Rs 2750: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on IndiaMART IndiaMART (INMART) reported 3QFY26 revenue growth of 13% YoY vs. our estimate of 11% YoY growth. Deferred revenue rose 17% YoY to INR17.5b. EBITDA margin expanded ~30bp QoQ to 33.5%, above our estimate of 31.1%. Adj. PAT was INR1,887m, up 56% YoY, and above our estimate of INR1,241m due to higher other income. This excludes the one-time impact of labor codes amounting to INR85m. For 9MFY26, revenue/EBITDA/adj. PAT grew 12.7%/1.4%/14.8% YoY. We expect revenue/EBITDA to grow 14.1%/2.2%, while adj. PAT is expected to decline 39% YoY (as other income normalizes) in 4QFY26. We reiterate our BUY rating on the stock, citing undemanding valuations, with a TP of INR2,750. Outlook Currently, INMART is trading at an undemanding valuation, in our view, as the valuations reflect uncertainties surrounding the churn rate, product-market fit, and subscriber growth. We value INMART on a DCF basis to arrive at our TP of INR2,750, assuming 11.5% WACC and 5.5% terminal growth. Reiterate BUY. title: Hindustan Copper shares rally 19% in two days as firm becomes preferred bidder for MP copper block
content: The shares of Hindustan Copper jumped more than 13 percent in trade on January 28, extending sharp gains for the third consecutive session. The stock has gained around 21 percent in 2026 so far. The sharp surge in the shares of the Vedanta Group-company comes amid the rally in copper prices, after the red metal gained 60 percent in 2025. Why Hindustan Copper prices are rising today? The latest surge in the stock also comes after the company announced on January 24 that it has emerged as the preferred bidder for Baghwari-Khirkhori Copper and associated mineral block in Madhya Pradesh. The company had participated in the state government’s e-auction for the grant of mining lease and composite license for the said block. “Since, HCL had submitted the highest final price offer, it has been declared as the Preferred Bidder for this auction,” it said. After the announcement, the shares of the company surged around 5 percent on January 27. The stock has now gained nearly 19 percent in just two sessions since the announcement. Copper rallies: Copper futures with February expiry rose nearly 2 percent to trade at Rs 1,328.95 per kilogram on Wednesday. The contracts are nearing its all-time high level of Rs 1,413.55 per kg. This comes amid falling dollar and supply constraints. Copper’s long-term fundamentals remain strong, and Indian investors increasingly seek global commodity exposure to help diversify their portfolios and use as hedges against inflation, said Ross Maxwell, Global Strategy Operations Lead, VT Markets. Hindustan Copper share price: Hindustan Copper shares have gained more than 19 percent in the past five days, and over 29 percent in the past one month. The stock rallied 154 percent in the past six months, and is up 26 percent in 2026 so far. The stock currently has a P/E ratio of 94.93, and the company’s market capitalization stands at around Rs 61,000 crore. Follow all LIVE updates from the stock markets here.

title: Buy Zee Entertainment Enterprises; target of Rs 133: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Zee Entertainment Enterprises Despite a turnaround in the digital business, we cut our EPS estimates by 17%/16% for FY27E/FY28E as recovery in linear TV business is expected to take longer than expected amid prolonged slowdown in FMCG spending. Z IN reported weak set of numbers as domestic ad-revenue declined for 7th quarter in a row with an EBITDA margin of 10.5% (PLe 12.0%). Led by improvement in viewership share (17.5% in 3QFY26; up 60 bps YoY) and continued momentum in the digital business we expect revenue CAGR of 5.2% over the next 3 years with EBITDA margin of 10.7%/15.5%/16.7% in FY26E/FY27E/FY28E. Outlook Backed by sharp earnings recovery and attractive valuations (9x/7.7x our FY27E/FY28E EPS) we maintain BUY with a TP of Rs133 (earlier Rs158). We have revised our target P/E multiple to 12x (earlier 14x) as we roll forward our valuation to FY28E. title: Buy Waaree Energies; target of Rs 3600: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Waaree Energies Waaree Energies (WAAREEEN) reported strong realization in Q3FY26 supported by strong execution with module/cell production of 3.51GW/0.75GW and an order book of ~Rs600bn, which showed strong sequential growth. The company also commissioned 2.1GW (Chikhli) and 3.0GW (Samakhiali) module capacity, and 3.1GW inverter capacity (Sarodhi), and saw strong order intakes of ~Rs1bn transformers (~1.3GW) and 10MWh BESS. US manufacturing progressed with ~275MW produced locally and ~Rs800mn IRA booked in 3QFY26. Oman polysilicon plant investment to secure a non-China supply chain, is at an advanced stage with production expected to start from Q4FY26. The company has continues to drive an integrated growth roadmap with targeted solar manufacturing capacity of 28.4GW modules, 15.4GW cells and 10GW ingots/wafers by FY27, BESS scale-up to 20GWh by FY28 with ~Rs100bn capex and ~Rs10bn equity raised so far. We estimate revenue/EBITDA/PAT CAGR of 21.7%/17.9%/ 8.0% over FY26-28E. Outlook We upward revise our FY27/FY28 earning estimate by 5.7%/1.2% Maintain ‘BUY’, with TP of Rs3,600 (earlier 4,084) valuing at 12x EV of Mar’28E EBITDA with an implying PE of 21x FY28E. title: Buy Coforge; target of Rs 2150: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Coforge The revenue growth performance (+4.4% QoQ CC) exceeded our estimates (+3.0% QoQ CC), aided by broad-based growth across verticals and service lines. BFS growth was slightly volatile due to ongoing transition of business head and partly on account of furloughs. The management was confident to derive growth within BFS and TTH on the back of 2 large wins in BFS out of the 6 large deal wins in Q3. The cumulative large deal wins in 9MFY26 stood at 16 vs 14 deals reported for the full year FY25. The order intake was robust at USD1.6b for 9MFY26 (+21% YoY), even the NTM executable order book stands healthy at USD1.7b (+26% YoY). We believe the cumulative large wins, strong revenue conversion and elevated order intake setting up solid foundation for organic USD growth of 17%/14% in FY27E/FY28E. On margins, the numbers were largely in line, while the company re-iterated to keep a tight band at ~14% operating level. Outlook We are passing on Q3 revenue beat, revising our FY26 organic revenue to ~25% (24.5% earlier). We are largely keeping our revenue and margin estimates unchanged for FY27E/FY28E. We assign 32x to FY28E EPS that translates a TP of 2,150. Maintain BUY. title: Buy Premier Energies; target of Rs 892: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Premier Energies Premier Energies (PREMIERE) reported strong module revenue growth of 39%, which was offset by 29% decline in cell revenue. It had a strong domestic order book of 9.4GW/Rs137bn as of Dec’25, with delivery visibility up to FY28. Beyond cells/modules, the company has commenced work on a 10GW ingotwafer facility at Naidupeta, AP, at a capex of Rs59bn, with Phase 1 (5GW) targeted to be completed by Dec’27 and Phase 2 (5GW) by Dec’28. It has completed its brownfield expansion of 400MW cell & 350MW module in Jan’26. Transcon’s transformer manufacturing capacity is expected to reach 16.7GVA by Jul’26, with mix upgradation toward MV/HV/IDT. KSolare acquisition is expected to be closed by Feb’26. Silver usage has gone down by 68% in the last 5 years and is expected to reduce by another 30%; suppliers are also close to introducing copper-based paste, instead of silver-based paste, over the next few quarters. PREMIERE expects domestic demand to be driven by PM Surya Ghar: Muft Bijli Yojana, KUSUM Scheme, IPP projects, and supported by utilityscale and EPC demand. Outlook We estimate revenue/EBITDA/PAT CAGR of 47.2%/ 34.2%/22.5% over FY26-28E. We tweak our FY27E earnings while downward revise our FY28E earnings estimate by 3.7%. Maintain ‘BUY’, with TP of Rs892 (earlier Rs1,106) valuing at 10x EV of Mar’28E EBITDA with an implying PE of 18x FY28E. title: Buy Kirloskar Pneumatic Company; target of Rs 1557: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Kirloskar Pneumatic Company Kirloskar Pneumatic (KKPC) delivered 18.8% YoY revenue growth, alongside 509bps YoY expansion in EBITDA margin to 19.5% in Q3FY26. During the quarter, persistent dispatch delays led to a build-up of inventory in large packages and impacted revenue recognition. However, improved procurement efficiencies supported margin expansion. The management has guided for Rs18-18.5bn revenue in FY26, supported by expected inventory liquidation by Q4FY26. Tezcatlipoca continues to be a key growth driver, with plans underway to double its manufacturing capacity. Refrigeration is expected to account for the lion’s share of revenue going forward, led by new product introductions and consumption-driven demand from end-industries such as F&B, dairy and pharma, while O&G is yet to witness a meaningful recovery, despite a modest uptick in order finalizations during the quarter. We revise our FY26/27E EPS estimates by -4.2%/-1.9%, considering the ongoing slowdown in inventory clearances. The stock is currently trading at a PE of 24.5x/19.9x on FY27/28E. Outlook We maintain our ‘BUY’ rating with a TP of Rs1,557 (Rs1,620 earlier), valuing the business at a PE of 32x Sep’27E (33x Sep’27E earlier) amid uncertainties surrounding dispatches and finalizations.
